factText: The wildfire, which has been named the Carr fire, began on Monday and has scorched over 48,000 acres (194 sq km) of land – an area larger than the city of San Francisco. As of today (Saturday July 28th) more than 500 structures have burned & the fire has grown to 80,000 plus acres — currently threatening the city of Redding. The Carr Fire in Shasta County had burned an area of more than 80,000 acres by Saturday morning, with a containment of still just 5 percent.

This explains why a fire can grow quickly despite weather in the region being fairly calm. Strong winds have whipped the flames into "fire whirls" that are overturning trees and cars. General weather conditions and the fire are creating hurricane force winds (75 MPH) in pockets causing the fire to react in ways that have never been seen by firefighters before.
